Package dt.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • dt.server.Server
  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Emiel Rous and Wouter Koning The class that runs the server.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts a Server-application.

      • testMain

        public static Server testMain​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the server application. This is a method exclusively used for testing.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments given to the server, which should just be the port of the server.
        Returns:
        The Server instance it has started, such that it can be used for testing purposes

      • getRankAsHashMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getRankAsHashMap()
        This method scans the file in which the rankings are stored, and then puts all of those names and rankings in a HashMap and returns that.
        Returns:
        A HashMap with all the players in it and their rankings.

      • addNewPlayer

        public static void addNewPlayer​(java.lang.String username)
        Adds a new player to the ranking system.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the player to be added.

      • increaseScore

        public static void increaseScore​(java.lang.String username)
        Increases the score of the player that has won
        Parameters:
        username - The winner of the game, whose ranking is now increased.

      • start

        public void start()
        The continuous loop that the server is running in, where it accepts clients and adds them to the list of connected clients.

      • getLoggedInUsers

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getLoggedInUsers()
        Returns:
        Returns a list of logged in users.

      • addUserToLoggedInList

        public void addUserToLoggedInList​(java.lang.String name)
        Adds a user to the users that is logged in.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the user to be added to the list of logged in users.

      • removeUser

        public void removeUser​(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a user from the list of logged in users.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the user to be removed from the logged in users.

      • isUserLoggedIn

        public boolean isUserLoggedIn​(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether a client is logged in or not.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the client.
        Returns:
        Whether a user is logged in.

      • getPort

        public java.lang.Integer getPort()
        Returns:
        The port that the server is running on.

      • setPort

        public void setPort​(java.lang.Integer port)
        Sets the port of the server. Note, changing this does not change the port of the server once it is running.
        Parameters:
        port - The port on which the server will be running.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The name of the server.

      • getAllClientHandler

        public java.util.List<ClientHandler> getAllClientHandler()
        Returns:
        A list of ClientHandler that are currently connected to the server.

      • getClientHandler

        public ClientHandler getClientHandler​(java.lang.String name)
        Looks for a ClientHandler with the name given in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ClientHandler that is trying to be found.
        Returns:
        The ClientHandler if it is exists, otherwise it returns null.

      • chatIsEnabled

        public boolean chatIsEnabled()
        Returns:
        returns whether the chat is enabled for this server or not.

      • rankIsEnabled

        public boolean rankIsEnabled()
        Returns:
        returns whether ranking is enabled for this server or not.

      • authIsEnabled

        public boolean authIsEnabled()
        Returns:
        returns whether authentication is enabled for this server or not.

      • cryptIsEnabled

        public boolean cryptIsEnabled()
        Returns:
        returns whether encryption is enabled for this server or not.

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Disconnects all clients using ClientHandler.shutDown(). It then shuts down the server and exits the program with exit code 69.

      • removeClientHandler

        public void removeClientHandler​(ClientHandler clientHandler)
        Removes a ClientHandler from the list of connected clients. The ClientHandler is shut down before removing it from the list.
        Parameters:
        clientHandler - The ClientHandler to be removed.
